title: The 50/30/20 Budget Rule: A Simple Way to Manage Money
excerpt: A straightforward budgeting method that allocates income across needs, wants, and savings.
editorial_summary: This article explains the 50/30/20 budgeting rule, which allocates 50% of income to needs, 30% to wants, and 20% to savings and debt repayment. It provides examples of how to categorize expenses, calculate percentages, and adjust the rule for different income levels. The content includes worksheets and tools to help readers implement this budgeting approach.
